title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 326-2.10 - Continuation of medical practice during proceedings
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 326-2.10 - Continuation of medical practice during proceedings

State Regulations

Until final action is taken by the chair on the findings
and recommendations of the county medical society, or the workers' compensation
committee of a county medical society, or the Medical Appeals Unit, the accused
physician, medical bureau or laboratory may continue in the practice of his or
her profession or the conduct of said bureau or laboratory under the Workers'
Compensation Law, unless otherwise specifically ordered by the
chair. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
326-2.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
